intro: Kallstroemia macrocarpa, commonly known as the large-fruited kallstroemia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the southeastern United States, particularly in areas of Georgia and Florida. The plant is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped pink to red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its foliage consists of dark green, elliptical leaves that are arranged alternately along the stems. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds, contributing to its propagation in suitable habitats.
